page.title: 04Police/Crime - Guisborough
page.content: The following is a report of the work of the local police force.The area covered by the Guisborough force is the largest in the North but the least inhabited.It stretches from Guisborough in the West to Easington in the East;the outskirts of Saltburn to the North and the North Yorkshire moors to the South. Guisborough has a low crime rate in comparison to other towns in the area.During the period from the first of Jan.1985 to the fourteenth of Jun'85,there were no murders;2 people committed suicide;2 houses were burgled;18 people were assaulted;39 cases of criminal damage (mostly to schools);99 cases of shoplifting;115 thefts, mainly of cars. Most road accidents were single car crashes.50% of police time goes on traffic incidents.
